One addition to the list of Bedrock values noted by Thomas Fields-Meyer and Richard L. Meyer (Op-Ed, March 25). As any parent who grew up with "The Flintstones" could tell you, it is the source of inspiration for what has to be the best-built car in America today: the Cozy Coupe toy car. Pollution-free, seldom, if ever, recalled for defects or life-threatening design flaws, the coupe and its variations are clearly the progeny of Fred and Wilma Flintstone's car.

Because of this, I look to "The Flintstones" to provide my children with keen insight into the evolution of industrial design. As such, its merits as educational programming should be evident. Perhaps it should be required viewing for Detroit's auto designers. PAMELA D. BRAVERMAN ROBERT M. LAKIN Shaker Heights, Ohio, March 29, 1993
